blog.name: queenof-meereen
blog.description: Zaldrīzes buzdari iksos daor

tags: we don't have time for catty drama
summary: TBH it hasn’t even been a full 24 hours and I’m already sick of seeing the opinion that they’re setting up dark!Dany and that...
body:
TBH it hasn’t even been a full 24 hours and I’m already sick of seeing the opinion that they’re setting up dark!Dany and that she was threatening Sansa in that conversation with Jon. 

I love Dany AND Sansa, and also understand that they’re coming from two different viewpoints. Sansa is the Lady of Winterfell and knows the Northerners are looking at Jon like Torrhen Stark (the King Who Knelt) right now, and are withdrawing support. They think they’re just going to get fucked over again like what happened with Robb. She’s looking out for her family and her people. At the same time, Dany left her campaign to fight Cersei and take King’s Landing, saved Jon and company’s asses beyond the Wall (before he bent the knee, mind you), lost one of her children (Viserion) and has turned her sights to helping save the North. She’s risking her life, her peoples’ lives (Dothraki, Unsullied, Missandei, etc.) and her two remaining dragons’ lives to help save the world. 

As D&D confirmed in the Inside the Episode after the show, Daenerys is understandably upset and frustrated that she’s being met with such opposition, but this isn’t really anything new to her. She probably just expected the family of the man she loves to be a little more welcoming. She’s used to having to be more aggressive in order to gain respect (which seems to be a common struggle among female rulers in a patriarchal society such as this). The Dothraki, for example, don’t respect or follow someone because they love them or because they have a certain name - they follow someone based on strength. The Iron Born are similar. Dany isn’t used to having to be soft with people in order to gain their respect. She tries this off the bat with Sansa and it backfires, so I think her default is to whip out that straight-backed, fire and blood mentality. Should she have executed the Tarlys? Probably Randyll, maybe not Dickon. But she can’t do anything about that now. She fucked up. And as Jon pointed out, he has executed men for disobeying him for less, and he wasn’t even a king. I personally am tired of all the men in this story being excused and held to a lesser standard for essentially doing the same kind of stuff. 

But basically that scene with Jon was trying to get him to understand that this isn’t some game of “Oh Sansa doesn’t like anyone, lol” because I think Jon can be a little daft sometimes. Dany is basically trying to get him to understand that if Sansa can’t show her respect, especially in public, how does he expect any of those tough Northern lords to ever respect her? If they win this war with the NK and Dany puts herself and everyone else she loves at risk, should she just be okay with having saved a bunch of people who will turn their backs on her? She isn’t a martyr and I think it’s unreasonable to expect her to be. It’s unreasonable to ask her to give everything to help these people and not have their respect or loyalty in return. 

Further, Daenerys clearly loves Jon, and he loves her. And in a recent interview Emilia talked about how Dany trusts Jon and listens to him and values his opinion. Why would she ever harm Sansa? Why would she ever harm a family member of the man she loves? It doesn’t make sense to make her a villain now, especially considering how we are repeatedly told that the North needs Dany. Her destiny is to help save the world and that is what she’s trying to do. I hope Dany and Sansa can at least meet somewhere in the middle, because I honestly think they’re pretty similar and could actually learn a lot from each other. 

Besides, we already have enough traditional villains. The Night King, Cersei, Euron, etc. Those are the things we should be worrying about. We should be worried about the real Mad Queen who is seemingly just delighted that the NK and his army have taken down the Wall. We don’t have time for catty drama between two major protagonists.

tags: me within 3 minutes of the episode: oh so we're being stupid-stupid for the final season huh
THAT IS IN NO WAY SHAPE OR FORM WHAT THEIR REUNION SHOULD HAVE BEEN
summary: ANYWAYS the jon/arya reunion was a kick in the teeth to book fans, jon stans, arya stans, anyone with common sense . . . i’ve...
body:
ANYWAYS the jon/arya reunion was a kick in the teeth to book fans, jon stans, arya stans, anyone with common sense …

i’ve been waiting for like SEVEN YEARS watching this shitshow for the jon/arya reunion. they were the two members of house stark who genuinely cared about one another, thought of each other as family, and consistently appear in each other’s narration in the books

and d&d really out here immediately trying to have jon turn arya and sansa against each other? i waited years for arya to have to immediately call her favourite brother a stupid bitch for doubting sansa who has literally been holding the north together for him for months.

that’s not jon. that’s not the reunion we deserved.

tags: i just don't know how to feel
summary:
dany literally BURNT THE FOOD! 
"what do dragons even eat?" 
"whatever they want."
bitch, you and your army can starve. i used...
body:
dany literally BURNT THE FOOD!

“what do dragons even eat?”

“whatever they want.”

bitch, you and your army can starve. i used to love dany but she’s being a real tyrant just like the rest of her family. at this point, sansa deserves the throne. and jon, he’s getting on my nerves too.

blog.name: kallypsowrites
blog.title: Kallypso Thoughts
blog.description: Welcome to the messy mind of an author, English teacher and maybe an adult. I post writing stuff sometimes. Mostly I reblog memes

summary: That scene where Arya sticks up for Sansa stood out to me for a very personal reason. Because what Arya is going through is very...
body:
That scene where Arya sticks up for Sansa stood out to me for a very personal reason. Because what Arya is going through is very similar to a situation I’m in right at this moment.

My older brother and I have always been close and I always likened my relationship with him to Jon and Arya. When I was a kid, especially, he was the one who shared my interests and I loved playing war games with him cause I was a tomboyish child. I ALSO have an older sister who is more feminine and has feminine interests and I used to quarrel with her more at the instance that I “wasn’t like normal girls”. If ther was an argument, I usually took my brother’s side.

But as I’ve gotten older, I’ve gotten closer to my sister. And now, my brother has this new girlfriend that my sister really does not like because of some red flags she has seen. I’m more neutral but I see both of their perspectives and I’ve seen my own red flags about the girlfriend

But, my brother always expects me to be on his side. So he tried to make my sister sound dumb and unreasonable and get me to join in on it. Because usually I would. But this time I did not allow it.

I see people saying that “Arya would never choose Sansa over Jon” or “Arya not supporting Jon and making him feel alone is bad”. But that’s what happens when you grow up. Things change. Relationships change. Everything shifts. You can’t expect things to go back to the way they are. And love? Real love? Is calling someone on their shit if you think they are wrong.

So it was my favorite scene of the episode, not just for the reunion but for the growth of the characters.

But, my brother always expects me to be on his side. So he tried to make my sister sound dumb and unreasonable and get me to join in on it. Because usually I would. But this time I did not allow it.

I see people saying that “Arya would never choose Sansa over Jon” or “Arya not supporting Jon and making him feel alone is bad”. But that’s what happens when you grow up. Things change. Relationships change. Everything shifts. You can’t expect things to go back to the way they are. And love? Real love? Is calling someone on their shit if you think they are wrong.

So it was my favorite scene of the episode, not just for the reunion but for the growth of the characters.
trail.content:
That scene where Arya sticks up for Sansa stood out to me for a very personal reason. Because what Arya is going through is very similar to a situation I’m in right at this moment.

My older brother and I have always been close and I always likened my relationship with him to Jon and Arya. When I was a kid, especially, he was the one who shared my interests and I loved playing war games with him cause I was a tomboyish child. I ALSO have an older sister who is more feminine and has feminine interests and I used to quarrel with her more at the instance that I “wasn’t like normal girls”. If ther was an argument, I usually took my brother’s side.

But as I’ve gotten older, I’ve gotten closer to my sister. And now, my brother has this new girlfriend that my sister really does not like because of some red flags she has seen. I’m more neutral but I see both of their perspectives and I’ve seen my own red flags about the girlfriend

But, my brother always expects me to be on his side. So he tried to make my sister sound dumb and unreasonable and get me to join in on it. Because usually I would. But this time I did not allow it.

I see people saying that “Arya would never choose Sansa over Jon” or “Arya not supporting Jon and making him feel alone is bad”. But that’s what happens when you grow up. Things change. Relationships change. Everything shifts. You can’t expect things to go back to the way they are. And love? Real love? Is calling someone on their shit if you think they are wrong.

So it was my favorite scene of the episode, not just for the reunion but for the growth of the characters.

summary: Why do you find Arya's comments to Jon unsettling?
question: Why do you find Arya's comments to Jon unsettling?
answer:
Hey anon,

I think what bothered me is the “us vs. them” undertone of the comment, especially given Sansa’s behavior throughout the episode. 

If it the comment had come after the revelation of Jon’s parentage than you could take the comment as Arya letting Jon know that she still sees him as her brother. Which is what you would expect from her and would be lovely. 

However, that’s not what happened here. This is an us vs. an outside Jon has chosen to ally himself with and to fall in love with. I don’t think it’s right to force Jon to choose between his family and the woman he loves and Arya’s words ringed of a hint of that. Now, she doesn’t know what Dany means to Jon and so one would hope when she finds out she’ll understand. But I get the feeling we’re in for a lot of miscommunication. 

TTFN

summary: ok so, i was thinking about jon’s non reaction to daenerys threatening sansa. and i think the image jon has of daenerys is very...
body: ok so, i was thinking about jon’s non reaction to daenerys threatening sansa. and i think the image jon has of daenerys is very different from the one we - as audience- have. like, he didn’t know about the tarly’s execution– you can see that when sam tells him. what if he simply thinks she’s just not capable? what if the debacle this season (for jon and for the audience) is coming to realize who daenerys actually is–

summary:
My favorite thing is how Jon reacts to when he keeps getting handed titles that he doesn’t want.
Jon:*gets named lord...
body:
My favorite thing is how Jon reacts to when he keeps getting handed titles that he doesn’t want.

Jon:*gets named lord commander*

Jon:*gets named king in the north*

Jon:*learns he’s the heir to the 7 kingdoms*
